visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a stock chart with the following specifications: Chart type: spline, Chart title: 'Stock Prices Comparison', Axes and labels styling: Use a dark background with white text for labels and titles, font size for labels should be 12px, font size for titles should be 16px, Data series: Include three series with data for MSFT, AAPL, and GOOG, Custom colors: Use specific colors for each series - MSFT: blue, AAPL: green, GOOG: red, Additional configurations: Set chart margins to 50px, add a legend with a white background and black text, and enable the range selector with the default selected range set to 1 month.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a spline chart with a dark background and white text for labels and titles. The chart title is 'Stock Prices Comparison' with a font size of 16px, and the axes labels have a font size of 12px. The chart includes three data series for MSFT, AAPL, and GOOG, each with specific colors: blue for MSFT, green for AAPL, and red for GOOG. Additional configurations include setting the chart margins to 50px, adding a legend with a white background and black text, and enabling the range selector with the default selected range set to 1 month. The y-axis labels are formatted to display percentage changes, and a plot line at 0% is included for reference.
